intro: Spermacoce pilosa, commonly known as the hairy false mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often with hairy stems and leaves. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and covered in fine pubescence. Spermacoce pilosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
